videos.title: Mii Channel Theme
videos.description:
I learnt this as a joke, but it's actually much harder to play than it sounds (as I make manifestly obvious throughout…)

The original in all its glory:

videos.title: Dot
videos.description: A piece by Canadian composer Jason Charles Beck, aka Chilly Gonzales. The way I play it sounds different to the way he plays it here (https://youtu.be/z-UFfmkkin4?t=20), but that also sounds different to the ways he plays it here (https://youtu.be/ATnrhTRoqlo?t=5) or here (), and they're all different to the way it's written in the sheet music, so I'm not hugely fussed by that.

videos.title: TSLAMP
videos.description:
An interpretation of "TSLAMP"  (whose chief lyric is "time spent looking at my phone"), from MGMT's 2018 album Little Dark Age. I hadn't played this for about a year before recording it, but I saw it on my list of planned (but never recorded) pieces for the 2018's edition of the Law Collection, and delusionally thought that I would still be able to play it with a semblance of fluency. As documented above, I was wrong.

Original song:

videos.title: Maud Gone
videos.description:
Originally from the 2011 self-produced album Monomania, "Maud Gone" was re-recorded once Car Seat Headrest was signed to Matador and transitioned from a teenager in his bedroom to a full band, and released on 2015's Teens of Style. I also borrow the melody of a sample used in some of the live performances of the track ().

2011 version: 
2015 version:

videos.title: Nefeli
videos.description: Played far too quickly.

videos.title: Pluto
videos.description:
"Pluto" comes from the 2017 album Planetarium, a collaboration between the oft-covered (by me) Sufjan Stevens, Bryce Dessner of the indie rock band The National, drummer James McAlister, and contemporary classical music composer and arranger Nico Muhly. I hadn't played it for a year or two before finding it on a previous year's tracklist-shortlist and attempting to see how much I could remember of it. (Spoiler: not much.)

Original song:

videos.title: Cosmic Hero
videos.description:
This is a very long song, and it turns out that without the lyrics, listening to the same four chords a hundred times over is really boring. Don't say I didn't warn you.

The original song isn't on YouTube, but this is:

videos.title: The Weather
videos.description:
I first learned (taught myself) this when it was released in 2017, but hesitated to record it because the principal thing that attracted me to the song was the instrumentation and the different timbres. I saw reducing it to a piano cover as stripping it of most of what was good about it … but my standards have fallen in the two years since then, so here we are.

videos.title: Blue Bucket of Gold
videos.description:
This is the last track from Sufjan's 2015 album Carrie & Lowell, and not the first I have covered from the album (https://youtu.be/0HMntDPdQII). As you  can tell, it was very unrehearsed, but it sounded too good on the grand piano to not at least attempt a cover.
